meanings.definition: Present or describe (something) as being greater, better, or more important than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: She always tends to make things seem more impressive than they really are, often overstating their value.
meanings.sent2: The news report overstated the severity of the storm, causing unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to exaggerate and overstate his accomplishments makes him the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of vibrant colors in the painting overstated the beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's claim that the product could solve all your problems was clearly overstated.

meanings.sent1: Don't believe everything he says; he tends to overstate the truth to make his stories more exciting.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overstate her achievements, making them sound more impressive than they actually are.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overstate the importance of his role in the project always makes us chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's jokes often overstate the absurdity of everyday situations, making them hilarious.
meanings.sent5: The author's use of vivid language in the novel overstates the emotions of the characters, drawing readers in.
